meanings.definition: Attempting to avoid notice or attention, typically because of guilt or a belief that discovery would lead to trouble; secretive.
meanings.sent1: She cast a furtive glance over her shoulder to make sure no one was following her.
meanings.sent2: The furtive behavior of the suspect caught the attention of the detective.
meanings.sent3: The furtive squirrel tried to sneak away with the nut without the other animals noticing.
meanings.sent4: His furtive movements in the dark alley made him seem like a shadow come to life.
meanings.sent5: The furtive whispers in the classroom hinted at a secret plan being hatched.

meanings.sent1: Her furtive glances at the teacher during the test revealed her anxiety.
meanings.sent2: The furtive behavior of the child made his parents suspect he had broken a rule.
meanings.sent3: The furtive cat's attempt to hide a broken vase was met with knowing looks from the family.
meanings.sent4: The furtive tapping of his foot during the meeting betrayed his unease.
meanings.sent5: The furtive smile on his face hinted at a mischief he was trying to conceal.
